alert.note: Alert for Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 11:41AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Windham, southeastern Worcester, southwestern Norfolk, south central Middlesex, west central Bristol, northeastern Washington, northern Newport, Kent, Providence and northwestern Bristol Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1140 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dudley to near Jewett City. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, along with heavy rain. Heavy rain may cause ponding or minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Woonsocket, Coventry, Cumberland, North Providence, Franklin, West Warwick, Johnston, North Attleborough, Milford, North Kingstown, Plainfield, Attleboro, Smithfield, Lincoln, and Central Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
